title: En
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101064313/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101064313/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : En**

Pronounced like it is spelled, an en is a measurement equal to half the [em](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101064313/http:/typophile.com/wiki/em). An [en dash](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101064313/http:/typophile.com/wiki/en%20dash) is a dash the width of the given en. Because "em" and "en" sound so much alike, the en is often referred to as the "nut," from which the term [nut fractions](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101064313/http:/typophile.com/wiki/nut%20fractions) is derived.
author: paul d hunt
